title: US President Jimmy Carter enters hospice care
description: The 98-year-old former US president, who placed a commitment on human rights and social justice during his presidency, will spend his 'remaining time' at home receiving hospice care.

title: 'When faced with technologies like ChatGPT, you can be both alarmist and skeptical'
description: The wave of concern and irony generated by chatbots is reminiscent of the excitement caused by previous innovations such as the blockchain, bitcoin, and metaverse.

title: US Secretary of State Antony Blinken warns China that balloon incursion 'must never happen again'
description: Blinken met with Chinese counterpart Wang Yi in Munich on Saturday amid growing tensions between Washington and Beijing.

title: In Argentina, the Russian baby 'boom' is worrying the government
description: Many Russian couples are giving birth to their children in the South American country, with the aim of obtaining a local passport by right of soil.

title: The common cat has become an 'environmental scourge'
description: As cute as they are, free-roaming felines are still super predators, harmful to biodiversity and have a considerable carbon footprint.

title: In Russia, summarized versions of books circumvent the sanctions
description: Abbreviated books with an indirect style are flourishing on the market in order to bypass the boycott of Western publishing companies.

title: French state ordered to compensate seven victims of civil servant who drugged women to watch them urinate
description: The former member of the high council for sexual equality and former deputy director of human resources at the Ministry of Culture kept a file entitled 'P Experiments,' listing nearly 200 victims.

title: Discovery of a meteorite in a French field 'like finding a needle in a haystack'
description: Thanks to an international scientific collaboration and the mobilization of a citizen science network, a 100g rock that fell from the sky two days earlier was found in Normandy on Wednesday.

title: Corinne Le Quéré: 'In France, we're not seeing the necessary deceleration in emissions'
description: In an interview with 'Le Monde,' the president of the High Council on Climate observes that while the French response to global warming isn't bad, there is no guarantee that the country will be able to meet its climate targets.

title: US formally accuses Russia of committing 'crimes against humanity'
description: Speaking at the Munich Security Conference on Saturday, Kamala Harris said that the Russian perpetrators will be held to account over Ukraine war.

title: China blasts US reaction to balloon as 'hysterical and absurd'
description: China’s most senior diplomat also described the shooting down of a balloon by the US as an abuse of the use of force.

title: Former Russian TV journalist Marina Ovsyannikova in exile: 'Only fear and the insanity of war remain'
description: Nearly a year following her outburst on live Russian television, the former Russian propagandist has fled to France to escape a heavy prison sentence.

title: The West uses Munich conference to present show of unity against Russia
description: Nearly a year after the start of the Russian invasion, the allies gathered at the security conference in Munich to once again assure Kyiv of their support. Emmanuel Macron stressed Moscow's 'failure.'

title: Meet Netanyahu's friend in French Parliament – whose election just got voided
description: Meyer Habib, a French-Israeli dual citizen, is a divisive figure at the Assemblée Nationale: partially because of his vociferous interventions, and partially because of his proximity to the Israeli prime minister.

title: Fox News' lies about Joe Biden's election exposed
description: According to a lawsuit taken against the conservative network, Fox News journalists and executives were fully aware that the election was not rigged.

title: In Kosovo, 'the war in Ukraine is a painful reminder'
description: For MP Vlora Citaku, who signed Kosovo's declaration of independence in 2008, her country's entry into the European Union represents an 'existential' matter. The country is still marked by the conflict with Serbia.

title: Ghanaian footballer Christian Atsu found dead after Turkey earthquake
description: Atsu had been missing since the February 6 earthquake that caused the collapse of his apartment in Antakya, Hatay.

title: French military lacks ammunition for high-intensity conflict
description: According to a new report, France's ammunition supplies are at their lowest and will not last more than a few weeks in the event of 'bitter' conflict.

title: North Korea fires ballistic missile in warning to South Korea and US
description: North Korea's first missile firing since January 1 comes as South Korea and the United States gear up for annual military exercises as part of efforts to fend off the North's growing nuclear and missile threats.

title: United States: Gunman kills six people in Mississippi
description: The deadly shooting comes days after a man, attacked a university campus in the northern state of Michigan, killing three people.

title: Le Pen's far-right RN blends into Parliament landscape, seven months after record gains
description: In June 2022, the Rassemblement National won 89 seats at the Assemblée Nationale. With the next presidential election in mind, their leader Marine Le Pen is firmly guiding them in an attempt to avoid xenophobic outbursts and to complete her life's work of mainstreaming the far-right party.

title: In France, a slight decrease in cystic fibrosis cases
description: Since 2002, there has been a downward trend in France. In Brittany, however, the trend is more pronounced because newborn screening was deployed much earlier in 1989.

title: Serigne Ibrahima Dieye's 'Black Jungle' exhibited in Paris
description: The Dakar-born artist is showing his latest works at the Cécile Fakhoury gallery, in the 8th arrondissement, until February 25. A first in Europe.

title: In Germany, the welcome mat is out for immigrant workers
description: In contrast to many of its European neighbors who are focused on repressing illegal immigration, Berlin promotes a more open-minded approach with a view to attracting labor

title: Frenchman Tony Parker listed as finalist for the basketball Hall of Fame
description: The four-time NBA champion with the San Antonio Spurs, is joined by Dirk Nowitzki, Pau Gasol and Dwyane Wade. The class of 2023 will be announced on April 1.

title: Air France emerges from pandemic stronger and more profitable
description: The airline took advantage of the Covid-19 crisis to radically transform itself, leading to substantial profit in 2022.

title: Traditional Chinese medicine: A pillar of Beijing's foreign policy in Africa
description: One of the health-care components of the "New Silk Roads," traditional Chinese medicine is dispersed through scientific and medical cooperation centers.
